channel.title: CVE Feed for Ping Identity -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Ping Identity -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-39219|2023-10-25T01:44:44.362Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: PingFederate Administrative Console dependency contains a weakness where console becomes unresponsive with crafted Java class loading enumeration requests

item.title: CVE-2023-39930|2023-10-24T20:54:08.795Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20radius%20pcv
item.description: A first-factor authentication bypass vulnerability exists in the PingFederate with PingID Radius PCV when a MSCHAP authentication request is sent via a maliciously crafted RADIUS client request.

item.title: CVE-2023-39231|2023-10-24T19:56:06.690Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit
item.description: PingFederate using the PingOne MFA adapter allows a new MFA device to be paired without requiring second factor authentication from an existing registered device. A threat actor may be able to exploit this vulnerability to register their own MFA device if they have knowledge of a victim user's first factor credentials.

item.title: CVE-2023-36496|2024-02-01T23:00:03.660Z -- ping%20identity -- pingdirectory
item.description: Delegated Admin Privilege virtual attribute provider plugin, when enabled, allows an authenticated user to elevate their permissions in the Directory Server.

item.title: CVE-2023-37283|2023-10-25T01:24:47.780Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Under a very specific and highly unrecommended configuration, authentication bypass is possible in the PingFederate Identifier First Adapter

item.title: CVE-2023-34085|2023-10-25T02:03:56.433Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: When an AWS DynamoDB table is used for user attribute storage, it is possible to retrieve the attributes of another user using a maliciously crafted request

item.title: CVE-2023-40148|2024-04-10T00:03:31.966Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Server-side request forgery (SSRF) in PingFederate allows unauthenticated http requests to attack network resources and consume server-side resources via forged HTTP POST requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-40545|2024-02-06T17:28:00.505Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: AuthenticationÂ bypass when an OAuth2 Client is using client_secret_jwt as its authentication method on affected 11.3 versions via specially crafted requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-23316|2024-06-05T18:41:55.387Z -- ping%20identity -- pingaccess
item.description: HTTP request desynchronization in Ping Identity PingAccess, all versions prior to 8.0.1 affected allows an attacker to send specially crafted http header requests to create a request smuggling condition for proxied requests.
